medaltemplates = }} '''Alexis Mac Allister''' (born 24 December 1998) is an Argentine professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[midfielder]] for [[Argentinos Juniors]], on loan from [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]].{{cite news|title=Alexis Mac Allister profile|url=https://int.soccerway.com/players/alexis-mac-allister/468060/|accessdate=13 November 2017|work=Soccerway|date=13 November 2017}} ==Club career== Born in [[La Pampa Province|La Pampa]], Mac Allister, like his two brothers, started his career with Club Social y Deportivo Parque before joining [[Argentinos Juniors]]' youth setup.{{cite web|url=https://www.clarin.com/deportes/futbol/argentinos-juniors/dinastia-mac-allister-alexis-kevin-francis-brotes-colorados-argentinos-juniors_0_Sy_9ndn_M.html|title=La dinastía Mac Allister: Alexis, Kevin, Francis, los brotes colorados de Argentinos Juniors|trans-title=The Mac Allister dynasty: Alexis, Kevin, Francis, the red prospects of Argentinos Juniors|publisher=[[Clarín (Argentine newspaper)|Clarín]]|language=es|date=6 March 2018|accessdate=15 January 2019}} He made his professional debut on 30 October 2016, coming on as a second-half [[Substitute (association football)|substitute]] for [[Iván Colman]] in a 0–0 [[Primera B Nacional]] home draw against [[Central Córdoba de Santiago del Estero|Central Córdoba]].{{cite web|url=http://www.diariojornada.com.ar/173315/deportes/empataron_argentinos_juniors_y_central_cordoba_/|title=Empataron Argentinos Juniors y Central Córdoba|trans-title=Argentinos Juniors and Central Córdoba draw|publisher=Diario La Jornada|language=es|date=30 October 2016|accessdate=15 January 2019}} Mac Allister scored his first professional goal on 10 March 2017, netting his team's first in a 2–1 away loss against [[Instituto Atlético Central Córdoba|Instituto]]. He contributed with three goals in 23 appearances during [[2016–17 Primera B Nacional|his first senior campaign]], as his side achieved promotion to [[Argentine Primera División|Primera División]] as champions. He made his debut in the latter category on 9 September, starting in a 2–1 loss at [[Club Atlético Patronato|Patronato]].{{cite web|url=http://espndeportes.espn.com/futbol/cronica/_/id/493468|title=Argentinos debutó con derrota en la Superliga|trans-title=Argentinos debuted with defeat in the Superliga|publisher=[[ESPN Deportes]]|language=es|date=9 September 2017|accessdate=15 January 2019}} On 25 November 2017, Mac Allister and his two brothers played all together for the first time, in a 1–0 loss at [[San Lorenzo de Almagro|San Lorenzo]]; Alexis and Francis were starters, while Kevin came in as a substitute.{{cite web|url=https://www.ole.com.ar/futbol-primera/superliga-argentina-san-lorenzo-argentinos-hermanos-mac-allister-francis-alexis-kevin-cancha_0_SkGfxFwlz.html|title=Los (tres) hermanos sean unidos...|trans-title=(Three) brothers be united...|publisher=[[Olé (sports newspaper)|Olé]]|language=es|date=25 November 2017|accessdate=15 January 2019}} He scored his first goal in the top tier on 5 March 2018, netting the opener in a 2–0 home defeat of [[Boca Juniors]].{{cite web|url=https://www.clarin.com/deportes/futbol/argentinos-juniors-boca-superliga-horario-tv-formaciones_0_B1AhHyj_z.html|title=Boca tuvo una noche muy mala y cayó con un sólido Argentinos|trans-title=Boca had a very poor night and fell against a solid Argentinos|publisher=Clarín|language=es|date=5 March 2018|accessdate=15 January 2019}} On 24 January 2019, Mac Allister signed for [[Premier League]] club [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]] on a four-and-a-half-year contract. As part of the deal, Mac Allister was loaned back to Argentinos Juniors for the remainder of the [[2018–19 Premier League|2018–19 Premier League season]].{{cite web |url=https://www.brightonandhovealbion.com/news/2019/january/albion-sign-argentinian-midfielder/|title=Albion sign Argentinian midfielder|website=Brighton & Hove Albion|date=24 January 2019|accessdate=24 January 2019}} ==International career== Shortly after debuting for Argentinos, Mac Allister received a call-up from [[Claudio Úbeda]] for the [[Argentina national under-20 football team|Argentina under-20s]].{{cite web|url=http://www.afa.org.ar/5916/el-semillero-de-los-mac-allister|title=El semillero de los Mac Allister|trans-title=The hotbed of the Mac Allisters|publisher=[[Argentine Football Association]]|language=es|date=13 November 2017|accessdate=13 November 2017}} ==Personal life== Mac Allister's older brothers [[Francis Mac Allister|Francis]] and [[Kevin Mac Allister|Kevin]] are also professional footballers.{{cite web|url=https://www.ole.com.ar/argentinos/triple-mac-allister-hermanos-argentinos_0_1874812593.html|title=Triple Mac|publisher=Olé|language=es|date=23 September 2017|accessdate=13 November 2017}} They are the sons of [[Carlos Mac Allister]] and nephews of [[Patricio Mac Allister]], both retired footballers. Mac Allister is of [[Scottish people|Scottish]] and [[Irish people|Irish]] descent. Some ancestors hailed from [[Fife]].{{cite news|title=Argentine football returns to its Scottihs founder|url=http://www.scotsman.com/sport/argentine-football-returns-to-roots-of-its-scottish-founder-1-1146916|accessdate=24 January 2019|work=The Scotsman|date=19 March 2018}} ==Career statistics==
